intro: Glinus setiflorus, commonly known as the hairy leaf glinus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and the Americas. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It typically grows in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Glinus setiflorus is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
